JobTitle: Operations & Metrics Lead, Global Partner Enablement Team
JobFullDesc: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization to achieve more. Our CEO’s partner-first vision for Microsoft puts the partner at the core of Microsoft’s strategic growth plan. A key contributor to partner growth and success, the Global Partner Solutions (GPS) Enablement Team collaborates across product, engineering, and learning to drive Microsoft mindshare and build end-to-end capability and capacity within our partner ecosystem. The GPS Global Enablement team engages across Microsoft’s Azure, Business Applications, Modern Work, and the Security, Compliance and Identity business groups as well as Worldwide Learning to deliver depth partner capability and capacity at scale through custom global skilling plans designed to meet joint business goals.   This role puts you at the heart of Microsoft’s investment in partner skilling, within one of the world’s largest companies, which drove more than $130 billion+ in revenue last year in the midst of several of the biggest disruptions the technology industry has ever seen. As a member of Microsoft’s GPS Enablement Team, you will drive partner capability through global programs that will fundamentally change the way partner companies are equipped to skill their workforce and play a critical role in driving competitive advantage and significant partner and Microsoft revenue growth. The group broadly focuses on three core activities:Engage with Microsoft’s product business groups to design and deliver valuable partner learning experiences, driving meaningful revenue impact for partners and Microsoft.Deliver Microsoft technical and non-technical skilling capacity and capability scale through remote, always-on and in-person events and learning journeys.Empower Microsoft field teams with the resources to drive local partner engagement with an emphasis on regional and local impact.As Operations & Metrics Lead, you are responsible for utilizing insights to drive area and global reporting. You will work in partnership with engineering to derive key metrics reporting and analysis from preferred platforms – providing actionable analysis to drive strategic planning and business decision-making, critical to the success and satisfaction of partners and Microsoft. You will work across engineering, business groups, and other internal stakeholders, as well as the GPS Enablement team, to provide actionable analysis, aligned to business priorities and partner needs. You are an agile and collaborative team member, comfortable working in partnership across functional teams, with matrixed stakeholders to define and achieve mutually beneficial outcomes. You operate with a high level of operational rigor, providing transparency into your workstreams and progress toward goals, consistently hitting deadlines and innovating to drive efficiencies in the process.ResponsibilitiesExperience analyzing and providing exec-level analysis and read outs, reflecting business performance and identifying meaningful areas of opportunities.Work with all partners, across all geographies, to deliver reporting that is most relevant indicator of partner success.Partner with engineering to ensure that critical data is captured and accessible within Enablement Insights.Document partner and internal stakeholder critical data requirements, and work with engineering to prioritize the accessibility of key data within existing tooling.Qualifications4+ years BI and reporting experience.Experience leveraging existing business intelligence tooling to derive reporting and provide exec-level analysis into business performance.Confident working across sales, marketing, engineering, and product teams to interpret and manage multiple stakeholder data requirements.Operations, learning, sales, marketing, or business analyst, comfortable navigating across a matrixed organization with several internal and external stakeholders.Experience identifying existing available data sources, documenting gaps and additional data requirements, and successfully prioritizing the build of new data into existing systems to drive comprehensive reporting and analysis.Understanding of the Microsoft subsidiary structure and roles and/or the GPS field organization is encouraged.Understanding of Microsoft's priority solution areas (Azure, Business Applications, Modern Work, Security) is encouraged, but not required. Additional Information:You will need to be available for both local time zone engagement and to actively participate in worldwide communications and rhythm of the business meetings.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
